titleStmt.title: H. W. Tuttle et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5301

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky.
The undersigned Citizens of Wayne County would respectfully represent that Benjamin Cannedy was indighted by the Grand Jury of this County at its last October term for tipling

Mr Kenedy is a poor man and acknowledges that he did let some of his relations who were sick have some whiskey that he had on hand for Medical purposes and perhaps some others that represented themsleves as wanting it for that purpose and that he was fined $60. for a violation of the laws of the State.
He states that he is a poor man and unable to pay the fine without material injury to his family, and would request that you remit the same.

H. W. Tuttle
F M Sumpter
S W Stephens
B.. Mills
G H Marcum
W Simpson
Jno L Sallee
H R Saufley
J R Dick
Wayne Cir Ct
vs
Benj Connedy
$60
Tip House
